Kriegsmarinewerft Wilhelmshaven

Stationing: u-boat flotillas
Large transport hub for for goods as well as a ship repair yard

Strategically important base of the Kriegsmarine.

Strategically important base of the Kriegsmarine. 

Stationing: u-boat flotillas

A very heavily secured British naval port.
Probably protected by nets and ground mines.
A large number of shipyards and a transhipment point for goods.

One of the largest and most important UK ports on the West Coast. 
The port is the main link between the UK and North America, the transatlantic SC- (Slow Convoy) and HX- (Halifax) convoys.

One of the largest ports on the French Atlantic coast.
During the Western campaign, the German military reached Saint-Nazaire in June 1940. The port was used as one of the main bases for U-boat operations from September 1940.

Stationing: Stationing: u-boat flotillas

With the conquest of northern France in June 1940, a submarine base was established in La Rochelle, also for the overhaul and refurbishment of submarines.

Stationing: u-boat flotillas

After the capitulation of France in June 1940, another submarine base was established in Bordeaux. 
The 12th Flotilla stationed there specialised in supplying other submarines at sea with torpedoes, rations and fuel.
The port of Freetown acts as an important convoy station for the Allies.
Internationally important for overseas trade and a transshipment centre for goods.

A very important port for  transatlantic routes vital to Allied war logistics.
The HX convoys probably started here.
The second most important port in Canada after Halifax and the starting point for many convoys aiding Britain in the war.

Kriegsmarinewerft Kiel
Mainly submarines were built in the shipyard.Especially the type VIIC.

Stationing: u-boat flotillas
One of the largest shipyards in the United Kingdom. In addition, many soldiers are shipped from here.
The port is the Royal Navy's most important naval base. Ammunition and warships are manufactured and stationed here.

La Spezia is an important naval base because of the French-Italian naval rivalry in the Mediterranean. It also serves as a submarine base for German submarines.

Stationing: u-boat flotillas

The island is one of the most important British naval bases in the Mediterranean and became a strategic target for the Axis powers after Italy entered the war.
The port is of central importance for disrupting supplies to the German and Italian troops in North Africa.

Key: Port of New York and New Jersey Description
English: The port is the starting point for many supplies bound for the west coast of England and also towards the Mediterranean sea.
Base of the British Mediterranean Fleet.
Stationing of the Russian Northern Fleet.
Important supply port for the North Sea convoys, through which the US supplies war materials and foodstuffs to the Soviet Union in accordance with the Lend-Lease Act.

Major transshipment centre for goods to and from Argentina.
Argentina sympathises with the Axis powers but is officially neutral.

The Key to the Mediterranean
Under the sovereignty of Great Britain. 
As a strategic command centre, Gibraltar has a strongly defended port from which ships can operate in both the Atlantic and the Mediterranean.
Neutral trading port on the Tejo Bay. Intelligence services from both sides are believed to be based here.

Immediately after the French defeat, the German commander of the Kreigsmarine, Rear Admiral D?nitz, visited the port of Lorient. As a result, the harbour was developed into one of the largest known U-boat bases

After the attack on Rotterdam, the "Rotterdam Blitz" the port was taken over by the Kriegsmarine.

Stationing: u-boat flotilla (outpost flotilla)
German U-boat supply base in Spain. Spain is neutral but is positive about the German presence. The supply bases are mostly merchant ships.
Military base of the Royal Navy of significant importance.
The island of Aruba is one of the world's largest oil refineries for the Allies.

Royal Air Force training base.
In addition to the Naval Air Gunnery School, several individual squadrons and units are based at RCAF Yarmouth.
The main coal exporting port in England.

Royal Air Force St. Eval is a strategic base for Coastal Command.
St Eval's main task is to enable anti-submarine and anti-shipping patrols off the south west coast.
An important naval base of the British Royal Navy's Fleet Air Arm.
Base of the British Royal West African Frontier Force.
British Royal Navy airbase in the Scottish Highlands.
Air base of both the Royal Air Force and US Army Air Force. Mainly sea-planes are operated from this base.
